titocc.compiler

Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • titocc.compiler.Scope

  • public class Scope
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a scope (aka namespace) that contains symbols declared within that scope.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scope(Scope parent, java.lang.String globalNamePrefix)
      Constructs a new Scope.

    • Method Summary

      Returns a collection of all subscopes.
      java.util.Collection<Symbol> getSymbols()
      Returns a collection of all symbols in this scope.
      boolean isGlobal()
      Tests whether this is the global scope.
      java.lang.String makeGloballyUniqueName(java.lang.String name)
      Generates a globally unique name by first adding the prefixes of the scope and all its parent scopes.

      • Scope

        public Scope(Scope parent,
     java.lang.String globalNamePrefix)
        Constructs a new Scope.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent scope, or null if this is the global scope
        globalNamePrefix - prefix used for this scope when generating globally unique names

    • Method Detail

      • isGlobal

        public boolean isGlobal()
        Tests whether this is the global scope.
        Returns:
        true if global scope

        public Scope getParent()
        Returns the parent scope.
        Returns:

        public java.util.Collection<Symbol> getSymbols()
        Returns a collection of all symbols in this scope.
        Returns:
        collection of symbols

      • find

        public Symbol find(java.lang.String name)
        Finds a symbol (e.g. a variable or a function) defined in this scope or any of its parent scopes.
        Parameters:
        name - identifier of the object
        Returns:
        the searched symbol, or null if none was found

      • add

        public boolean add(Symbol symbol)
        Adds a new symbol to the scope if no symbols with the same name exist already.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Symbol to be added.
        Returns:
        true if succeeded, or false if symbol was not added (already exists)

      • addSubScope

        public void addSubScope(Scope subScope)
        Adds a new subscope in this scope.
        Parameters:
        subScope -

      • getSubScopes

        public java.util.Collection<Scope> getSubScopes()
        Returns a collection of all subscopes.
        Returns:
        collection of subscopes

      • makeGloballyUniqueName

        public java.lang.String makeGloballyUniqueName(java.lang.String name)
        Generates a globally unique name by first adding the prefixes of the scope and all its parent scopes. Then tries number suffixes starting from 2 until the name is unique.
        Parameters:
        name - local name
        Returns:
        a globally unique name
